SENT.plain: Two cases of patients with prostatic granulocytic sarcoma in whom urinary obstruction occurred are presented
The diagnosis was made by tissue examination with hematoxylin and eosin and specific esterase stains
One patient had a myelodysplastic syndrome and the other patient had acute myeloblastic leukemia
In both cases the diagnosis of prostatic granulocytic sarcoma was unexpected
Granulocytic sarcomas should be considered in the differential diagnosis of urinary obstruction in patients with myeloproliferative or myelodysplastic syndromes
